Class MainMemory

  • java.lang.Object
    • MainMemory

  • public class MainMemory
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MainMemory(java.lang.String fileName)
      Creates an instruction memory object and initializes the memory to data input from a file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainMemory

        public MainMemory(java.lang.String fileName)
           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates an instruction memory object and initializes the memory to data input from a file. File format: first value is an integer with the number of bytes for this instruction memory. Then file has boolean values for the binary data to put into this instruction memory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The pathname of the file to read into this memory
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the pathname does not specify a file that can be opened

    • Method Detail

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Writes the contents of memory back to a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The pathname of the file to read into this memory
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the pathname does not specify a file that can be opened

      • read

        public boolean[][] read(boolean[] address,
                        int bytes)
        Returns the data that begins at the specified address.
        Parameters:
        address - The byte address where to begin reading.
        bytes - The number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The data read from memory. Index 0,0 of the array holds the least significant bit of the data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the address is not valid.

      • write

        public void write(boolean[] address,
                  boolean[][] data)
        Writes a 32-bit value to memory
        Parameters:
        address - The address where to begin writing.
        data - The binary value to write to memory. Index [0][0] of the array is the least significant bit of the binary value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if address is not a valid memory address, or if the value parameter does not have length of 32.

      • printMemory

        public void printMemory()
        Use for visually checking contents of memory

      • printMemory

        public void printMemory(java.io.PrintStream output)
        Use for visually checking contents of memory
        Parameters:
        output - The output stream.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of this memory unit in Bytes.
        Returns:
        the size of this memory unit in Bytes.
